data.decision: Stop engineering Duro's systems when 10-20 real tasks pass: (1) ≥80% context precision (injected skills actually used), (2) ≤1 recall miss per 10 tasks, (3) budget discipline without babysitting, (4) deterministic (same task → same pack). Then freeze and ship features.
data.rationale: Engineering ends when next improvement stops buying real wins. Current skeleton (Gate, Amplifier, Bounded Expansion) is minimum viable. Third-order cleverness before paying "does this help real tasks?" debt = over-engineering. Standing at cliff edge now.
alternatives: Continue adding features (EXPANSION_SCORE tweaks, multi-domain priority, draft status)
Freeze system entirely and only ship workflows
data.context: User feedback during design workout session. Duro has: 2200+ artifacts, 31 skills, 13 rules, decision closure system, debug gate. Next phase should be validation runs, not more features.
